page.title: 17Trent and Mersey Canal
page.content: The main tourist facility in the area is the Trent and Mersey Canal. This flows from north to south and encom- passes bridges 48 to 39. At bridge 46 there is a signpost giving distances. Shardlow is 23 miles and Preston Brook is 69 miles. A survey was carried out during July and August to establish modern usage of the canal. Most users were holiday makers in pleasure boats. Nearly all had hired re-conditioned canal barges. Thirty nine boats were recorded. After boating, fishing was quite a popular activity, then walking along the canal tow path and there was even one person feeding the ducks. No swimmers were seen and no commercial barges were recorded.
